column11: Public Assistance(Living)
column14:
=[Actual Receiving Amount]*[the proportion of Living in the Public Assistance Payment(%)]
[Actual Receiving Amount]=[Minimum Cost]-[Earning + Pension + Other Subsidies or Payment]
[Minimum Cost]=[Basic standard]+[Single-parent addition]+[Child raring addition]
①There is a minimum cost of living threshold, mainly depending on the compositon of the household. ②If a household's total income, including earnings, pension, subsidies or payments that received, is lower than the minimum cost of living, the household is eligible to receive Public Asisstance, so the insufficient part of money will be paid. ③The Public Asisstance consists of two basic parts when it comes to cash benefits: living and housing. We calculate the amount of Public Asisstance payment when the household's income is not Zero, and devide it into living and housing benefits with a proper ratio(please refer to the sheet named Public Allowance Proportion).

column11: Public Assistance(Housing)
column14:
=[Actual Receiving Amount]*[the proportion of Housing in the Public Assistance Payment(%)]
[Actual Receiving Amount]=[Minimum Cost]-[Earning + Pension + Other Subsidies or Payment]
[Minimum Cost]=[Basic standard]+[Single-parent addition]+[Child raring addition]
①There is a minimum cost of living threshold, mainly depending on the compositon of the household. ②If a household's total income, including earnings, pension, subsidies or payments that received, is lower than the minimum cost of living, the household is eligible to receive Public Asisstance, so the insufficient part of money will be paid. ③The Public Asisstance consists of two basic parts when it comes to cash benefits: living and housing. We calculate the amount of Public Asisstance payment when the household's income is not Zero, and devide it into living and housing benefits with a proper ratio(please refer to the sheet named Public Allowance Proportion).
